title: Instructional Strategy Design to Mitigate Fatigue in Online Mathematics Education [Large-Scale]

context.prior_knowledge: College-level foundational mathematics knowledge and online learning tool utilization experience
context.additional_context: A math education course for working professionals incorporating project-based assessments

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain at least three fatigue factors occurring during online lectures.
Learners can establish self-directed learning plans using asynchronous course materials.
Learners can complete math problem-solving projects incorporating peer feedback through small-group collaboration tools.
Learners can improve learning concentration by over 30% by applying 20-minute interval activity-switching strategies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
